page.title: 01The Town of Bridgnorth
page.content: Bridgnorth is a typical small Market Town with interesting historical associations. There is evidence to show that settlements existed in the times of the Saxons and Danes and, in and around Bridgnorth, there is a wealth of inheritance from the Norman Conquest. Its first charter dates from 1157, and the freemen, or burgesses, of Bridgnorth played a real part in the government of the town. Since 1835, Bridgnorth has had a Town Mayor, and the Civic Regalia is used on ceremonial occasions such as the Traditional Mayor-making and Civic Sunday. A number of timbered building from the 17th. century are still in evidence though much was destroyed by fire at the time of the Civil War in 1646. Much of the character of the town has been retained and it is a popular tourist centre in the Summer.
